treble.translation[0].definitions[0].def: three times as big, as much, or as many as something else
treble.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: They sold the house for treble the amount they paid for it.
treble.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to become three times as big in amount, size, or number, or to make something increase in this way
treble.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Their profits have trebled in the last two years.
treble.translation[2].definitions[0].def: the upper half of the whole range of musical notes
treble.translation[2].definitions[1].def: a boy’s high singing voice, or a boy with a voice like this
treble.translation[2].definitions[2].def: the part of a musical work that is written for a treble voice or instrument
treble.translation[3].definitions[0].def: a treble voice or instrument produces high notes
treble.translation[4].definitions[0].def: to become three times as big in amount
treble.translation[4].definitions[0].exa: Net income more than trebled, to £5.7 million.
A federal jury awarded $2 million in damages, to be trebled under antitrust law.
